symptoms.name: Monoarticular or oligoarticular arthritis
symptoms.severity: Variable, ranging from brief arthralgia to persistent swelling and pain
symptoms.pattern: Recurrent attacks, intermittent swelling and pain, may be chronic

symptoms.name: Joint pain (arthralgia)
symptoms.pattern: May occur early in infection, often asymptomatic

physical_findings: Asymmetric swelling and pain in large joints

lab_values.IFN-\u03b3: Exceptionally elevated levels, persisting in post-infectious period

risk_factors: Infection with highly inflammatory RST-1 type strain of Borrelia burgdorferi
Steroid use prior to antibiotic treatment (in children)
Longer duration of arthritis prior to diagnosis (in children)
Poor initial response to antibiotics (in children)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with Lyme arthritis (monoarticular or oligoarticular arthritis)
supportive: History of tick bite in endemic area
